SLS1282 - Foundations of American Univer.name: SLS1282 - Foundations of American University Life

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Orientation of international students to American cultural contexts. Success through active, learner-centered dynamics. Methods to sustain student success beyond the first year and the university.

College.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

SLS2311C - Overview of Select Medical Ca.name: SLS2311C - Overview of Select Medical Careers

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview of the pre-health professions process for careers in medicine, dentistry, veterinary, optometry, pharmacy, podiatry, and chiropractic.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: COS Major; First-term transfer student with 60+ hours.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Designed to help new transfer students connect, acclimate and succeed at UCF and in the College of Sciences. Students will explore their respective College of Sciences majors, develop relevant skills and discover how or if their major aligns with their goals and intended career.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Training peer educators in helping strategies applicable to their peer leadership positions.

Department.text: Department of Educational Leadership & Higher Education

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An entryway into personal leadership, motivation, finances, integrity, and time management. Topics covered include budgeting, intrinsic versus extrinsic motivation, intercultural competence, and career management.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: First Time in College (FTIC) standing or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Assist student transition to the University by developing important academic, life, and study skills that promote student success and persistence through first year and beyond.
